definitions.definition: An addition or annex to a group, set, or total.
examples: The poem was a new inclusion in the textbook.

definitions.definition: The act of including , i.e. adding or annexing, (something) to a group, set, or total.
examples: The inclusion of the poem added value to the course.

definitions.definition: Anything foreign that is included in a material,
Any material that is trapped inside a mineral during its formation, as a defect in a precious stone .
A nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregate of stainable substances .
An object completely inside a tissue, such as epidermal inclusion cyst , a cyst in the epidermis.
A mapping where the domain is a subset of the image .

main_definition: ( countable ) An addition or annex to a group, set, or total.
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) The act of including , i.e. adding or annexing, (something) to a group, set, or total.
( countable ) Anything foreign that is included in a material,
( countable , mineralogy ) Any material that is trapped inside a mineral during its formation, as a defect in a precious stone .
( cytology ) A nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregate of stainable substances .
( histology ) An object completely inside a tissue, such as epidermal inclusion cyst , a cyst in the epidermis.
( mathematics ) A mapping where the domain is a subset of the image .
